summary: A simple free messaging app called 'alatele' with Greek alpha symbol (α) as icon/image. Users enter with a random username (no authentication). Users can delete and edit their messages. No subscription or payment required.
architectural_notes: No authentication system - users enter with random usernames
Greek alpha (α) symbol used as branding/icon
Users can delete and edit their own messages
Completely free service with no subscription or payment requirements

existing_features.title: Create a username entry screen where users can type any random username to enter the messaging app without authentication
Build a simple messaging interface where users can send and receive messages in real-time
Display the alpha symbol (α) as a prominent icon or logo in the app interface
Apply a clean, minimalist design theme with modern typography and cohesive color palette suitable for a messaging application
Render the generated alpha symbol image as a static asset in frontend/public/assets/generated
Update the application name from 'Alatele2' to 'Alatele' in the Header component and all UI-facing locations
Add a delete button to each message that allows users to delete their own messages
Add an edit button to each message that allows users to edit their own messages
Create React Query hooks for delete and edit message operations with automatic cache invalidation

new_feature_requests.summary: Add alpha symbol (α) as app icon/image
Implement random username entry for login
Create backend storage for messages with username, content, and timestamp fields
Add ability for users to delete their own messages
Add ability for users to edit their own messages
Extend the backend Message type to include a unique message ID field for identifying individual messages
Implement backend functions for deleting a message by ID and editing a message's content by ID
Remove subscription/payment system and make app completely free for all users
Remove any subscription, payment, or premium tier UI elements from all frontend components
Remove any subscription or payment-related backend logic, data models, and API endpoints
